title: Fewer hospital patients in Covid-19 hotspots
description: Hospital admissions are not rising despite increases in coronavirus cases, according to NHS England data.

title: Free school meals 'should be extended' for pupils from low-income migrant families
description: Pupils from low-income migrant families should keep getting government support, say charities.

title: The Papers: Results "fiasco" and new UK quarantine for France
description: Many of Friday's papers lead on reaction to A-level results and calls for the system to be reviewed.

title: Mauritius oil spill: Are major incidents less frequent?
description: Oil slicks can lead to major environmental disasters but industry experts say regulations are now much tighter.

title: Beirut blast: Picking up the pieces of a shattered city
description: The destruction goes for miles, but Beirutis are slowly picking up the pieces in a broken city.

title: Babyteeth: The teen film tackling cancer with humour
description: Its star Eliza Scanlen, says the script had "more life than anything I've read in ages".

title: Quiz of the week: Who was named the world's highest-paid male actor?
description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

title: Georgia School: 'We walked into a dangerous situation'
description: A photo of the crowded school hallway went viral, and since then nine people have tested positive.

title: Fans to be allowed to attend Crucible final as government green lights pilot events
description: Fans to be allowed into the Crucible Theatre this weekend for the final of the World Snooker Championship, BBC Sport understands.

title: The girl who picked up an AK47 to defend her family
description: An Afghan girl was hailed as a hero, but her story was more complicated than it first looked.

title: Bangladesh: Losing my job as a garment factory worker
description: Sonia is one of thousands of garment workers who have lost their jobs in Bangladesh due to Covid-19.

title: Coronavirus travel: Majorca's party capital deserted
description: Majorca's famous party destination Magaluf has been left deserted because of coronavirus.

title: Robots go their own way deep in the ocean
description: Firms are building robots that can survey the seabed and underwater structures without human help.

title: 'We were all packed, then they cancelled our holiday'
description: Hundreds of would-be holidaymakers are finding their bookings have been cancelled last minute.

title: ‘Raise sick pay’ to lower virus health and economic risk
description: It would manage a "crude" trade-off between lives and jobs as the UK economy reopens, a report says.

title: Leipzig shock Atletico to reach Champions League semi-final
description: RB Leipzig will play Paris St-Germain in the last four of the Champions League after Tyler Adams' late deflected winner knocks out Atletico Madrid.

title: 'He's exhausted after that' - The one with Anthony McGill and the really long snooker cue
description: Anthony McGill uses all the extensions available to him to help with a difficult shot but then decides not to use it in a tense semi-final with Kyren Wilson.

title: Coronavirus: Lockdown to ease further in England from Saturday
description: More beauty treatments, small wedding receptions and live indoor shows can resume this weekend.

title: Fortnite: Apple ban sparks court action from Epic Games
description: Epic Games says it is taking Apple to court over "monopolistic" policies after it banned Fortnite.

title: Israel and UAE strike historic deal to normalise relations
description: Israel and the United Arab Emirates agree to normalise relations in the third Israel-Arab peace deal.

title: Defending champion Andreescu pulls out of US Open
description: Defending champion Bianca Andreescu withdraws from this year's US Open because the coronavirus pandemic has hampered her return from injury.

title: Trump blocks postal funds to prevent expanded mail-in voting
description: The Postal Service requires emergency funds to cope with the pandemic and the election, Democrats say.

title: Bowlers put England on top against Pakistan - report & highlights
description: England's bowlers grab the upper hand in the second Test against Pakistan on a weather-affected first day at the Ageas Bowl.

title: England v Pakistan highlights: James Anderson leads the way as England get their noses in front on a rain-affected day
description: James Anderson leads the way for England as the hosts take five wickets on a rain-affected day at Southampton to put themselves in a strong position in the second Test against Pakistan.

title: Coronavirus: Greencore staff self-isolate after outbreak
description: Health officials are working with the sandwich makers in Northampton, where 299 tested positive.

title: Coronavirus: Preparing for a post-lockdown musical
description: The cast and crew of Sleepless describe the preparations for their ''coronavirus-safe'' production.

title: Ronnie O'Sullivan punches table at World Snooker Championship in match against Mark Selby
description: Ronnie O'Sullivan punches the table after missing a tough pink at the World Snooker Championship in his semi-final match against Mark Selby.

title: A-level results: 'My future has been set back completely'
description: Students share their disappointment after their predicted exam results were downgraded.

title: A-level results day: 'I haven't got into uni because of it'
description: Some students who haven't got the results they wanted are angry about how the situation has been dealt with.

title: A levels: Why did I not get the grades I expected?
description: Education editor Branwen Jeffreys explains how A-level grades were decided this year and what you can do if you didn't get what you expected.

title: Beirut explosion: Children dealing with the trauma of the explosion
description: Thousands of injured, displaced and traumatised children are dealing with the aftermath of the port explosion.

title: Lightning pictures: Spectacular storms light up England skies
description: Photos from across England show a remarkable lightning show on a stormy Wednesday night.

title: Belarus elections: Shocked by violence, people lose their fear
description: Defiance is spreading in the face of attacks by police on people in the streets and detainees.
